articles.title: Coolest Rocky Exoplanet Ever: James Webb Reveals Surprising Atmosphere of TRAPPIST-1 C - SciTechDaily
articles.description: Infrared measurements of TRAPPIST-1 c indicate that it is probably not as Venus-like as once imagined. NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope has successfully measured the heat radiating from TRAPPIST-1 c, an exoplanet orbiting a red dwarf star 40 light-years from…
articles.content:
BySpace Telescope Science InstituteJune 25, 2023

articles.title: The Clouds of Venus Could Support Life - Universe Today
articles.description: A recent study published in Astrobiology examines the likelihood of the planet Venus being able to support life within the thick cloud layer that envelopes it. This study holds the potential to help us better understand how life could exist under the intense …

articles.title: The Earth's Rotational Pole has Shifted from All the Groundwater We've Pumped Out - Universe Today
articles.description: Earth is, in many ways, a water world. Around two-thirds of its surface is covered in water, and the oceans that provide that cover make up over 96% of all water on Earth, according to the US Geological Survey. Glaciers and ice caps make up another 1.74%, but…
